page.title: 09LIFE IN OGBOURNE ST ANDREW
page.content: {Interviews with children who live {there produced this description of the {village. Ogbourne St Andrew is a fairly small village, and quiet except for the farm noises and the traffic noises from the main road.The River Og runs through it.It has a private school where about 30 children go from three to twelve. The village church is St Andrew's, and it is linked with St George's church as it has the same vicar.Most people own their own transport but some go by bus.There are two farms.There is a shop which sells some vegetables fruit and groceries.There is one pub called The Wheatsheaf.There is a WI meeting held every week.Previously a variety of activities took place in the village hall but it has now been demolished. Newspapers and milk are delivered daily.
